website_summaries.verdict: An excellent option if you need a full-sized blender at a mid-range price. The best value for your money when it comes to Ninja blenders.
pros: Versatile, combining a powerful 1000 watt motor and a six-blade assembly that transforms ice into snow in seconds
It's 72-ounce blending pitcher is handy for big-batch blending
cons: Shakes still come out a little grainy and the blender is loud

customer_reviews.title: Read before you buy. Warranty Info.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to really like this product based on all the positive reviews I read. I bought it in August, and now it's November and the pitcher has cracked. I used it may be once a week to blend smoothies. The pitcher is not covered by their 1 year warranty, which is ridiculous, like it's an extra part or something. To return the product you have to pay $19.99. Is it worth it? You decide for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Jen B.

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed because because we cant seem to ave the option ...
customer_reviews.text: My mom had got one of these blenders and it had gotten four symmetrical cracks in all four bottom of the plastic container causing it to leak, thinking we stored it wrong causing the cracks we bought another. Not more than the two weeks we had the new one simply crushing ice had put the same identical four cracks in the new blender. I'm disappointed because because we cant seem to ave the option to return either blenders, which are now useless. its a shame because the blenders worked great other than the cracking feature. file:///C:/Users/Jacob/Downloads/IMG_0742.jpg
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Updating my review 1.5 years after purchase. I loved my blender, but it literally broke into pieces after only a year and change. A few months after I got it, a crack started to form and eventually just broke wide open. Keep in mind, I only used this to make smoothies, it wasn't heavily used or anything. I'm so disappointed. My thrift store blender lasted longer than this. I expect much more for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Dee

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is laughable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: easy to use, cleans easy in dishwasher, blends thoroughly, safe locking/starting mechanism Cons: Ninja customer service is a joke if something fails. Weak pitcher latch on ours broke 45 days after purchase & was told a replacement pitcher was $65, Warranty was only valid if purchased directly from them and only covered the motor/base: lid and pitcher are not. No 60 day guarantee or years warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More Like a Conscientious Objector 🙏
customer_reviews.text: Another case of "Should've read those negative reviews..." Can't believe the condition of these blades from blending frozen fruit into smoothies. This isn't just an issue of poor quality - but also a potential health and safety hazard. Spend the extra $ and get something meant to last.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Not even 6 months old, only used maybe 10 times, stoped working, power button blinks but nothing works. I have all the arrows lined up, everything on right, nothing. Went online and so many people bought this blender have same problem. Waste of money. No stars for me
customer_reviews.author: DEEDEEPD

customer_reviews.title: Nice blender but.....
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this blender for 5 months and worked great. Super powerful blender with nice design. But, the plastic jar since to be made of a poor quality plastic because it cracked while blending. I use the blender around 4 to 5 times a week, I only blend fruits and I don't even use ice. I've been trying to contact the seller but not answer. Phone just keep ringing. I'm very disappointed for what it could have been a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Izq Lev

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking to waste your time and money, this is the product for you!!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this is the most overpriced and frustrating piece of garbage... it's a blender, it shouldn't be rocket science to get it to work, I went through every troubleshooting step and could never get this to start blending. This is the SECOND incredibly overpriced item I've bought from ninja that doesn't work and I will NEVER buy from them again. Complete waste of time and money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: Pitcher cracks too easily
customer_reviews.text: The blender is fine, but the pitcher keeps cracking, almost immediately. I had a replacement pitcher sent after a month of use, and the first time I use the replacement there was a crack forming. It took a few weeks or so for the corner to completely break off, and more cracks are forming around the base still. I reached out to Ninja and I would have to pay $64 for a 2nd replacement, which seems crazy since this is clearly a defect. I'm only using this to make smoothies with frozen blueberries and bananas mostly, so there should be no reason that this keeps happening.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hays

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my Ninja for nearly four years and it’s still going strong. My average use is about 3 times/week. It still blends great, I’ve never had the plastic break, I’ve never been cut by the blades. Handle it with care and you’ll definitely get your money’s worth out of this investment.
customer_reviews.author: RBoz

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Blender Recipe
customer_reviews.text: 2 oz white rum (don q cristal), 1 oz coco lopez coconut cream, 1 oz heavy cream, 6 oz pineapple juice, 1 cup of ice, 1 spoonful of unsweetened coconut shreds. Put aforementioned ingredients ONLY in a NINJA blender on medium blend for 11 seconds. garnish with a cherry, pineapple and cocktail umbrella and BLAAAAM! a perfect pina freakin colada brah
customer_reviews.author: eight1178

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality construction.
customer_reviews.text: The blender jar cracked and leaks after just 1 and half months of light use. It was not dropped or slammed, just cracked by the spinning part at the bottom. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over Engineered and Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: The unit is made out of really cheap plastic with an over engineered locking lid that is way too heavy and has sharp edges. The lid slipped from my hand and fell less than 12 inches onto my dining room table and put a large dent in it. It makes me wonder if the manufacturer made the effort to test it in an actual home before making it available for sale. It is awful at blending, especially when considering the price of the unit. I ended up returning it and buying a $25 Hamilton Beach unit which puts the Ninja to shame.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Vanderwel

customer_reviews.title: The long Blades are a hazard...
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who cares about their safety should think twice before purchasing this juicer. The juicer blades are long and really dangerous. The juicer in general is not well suited for volumes below 1 litre. If you are juicing or making smoothies for yourself alone, then you are better off with a juicer with normal blades. Too much of fruits/veggies stick to this long blade and it is not easy to clean or touch it. To my amazement, there are such a huge number of 5 star reviews here, which can be misguiding to normal customers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it a bunch.
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a food processor but, being we are a small family, I've found this blender will do most everything my processor did, The quality feels great and it's easy to clean up. It's my favorite appliance these days.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lutz

customer_reviews.title: Pitcher cracks
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender... until the pitcher cracked. I've had it less than 2 years, and use it 3-4 times a week. The pitcher has never been in the dishwasher, I always wash it by hand. But the pitcher has now cracked, and it drips liquid. I'm guessing that it'll get worse. The pitcher costs as much as a new blender on Amazon, and only $15 less than a new blender at the manufacturer's site (although I'm guessing that after shipping, it's the same price). This seems to be the primary complaint about this blender.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Who designed this?? Serious design flaw!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this blender. However, there’s a rather significant design flaw. There’s absolutely no blade at or near the bottom!! We make our smoothies one at a time and nothing blends when your single serving of fruits doesn’t come up to the FIRST BLADE!! I am so frustrated because this was supposed to be our solution to get us to eat healthier. While getting this ready to be returned, I noticed that water is INSIDE the handle! There’s no possible way to get the water out! We hand washed it after every use. We never put it in the dishwasher.?! Whoever designed this blender needs to use it too!
customer_reviews.author: o2b_moi

customer_reviews.title: Adopt a ninja today!
customer_reviews.text: It is as strong as it looks, that's for sure! I loved it. It's easy to clean, and I loved the safety feature. It also has a very soft lock system. And you only need to clean 3 things: the jug, the lid and the EASILY removable blades. There's no rubber+blade+plastic combo that takes hours to dry out or smells like baby vomit. No! Just one long set of blades in hard plastic. OMG! :O I only had cheap blenders before this - a whole life of regret...
customer_reviews.author: Juliana and Manuel

customer_reviews.title: FREAKING AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I got so tired of having to open up my old blender every second and stir the mixture to get the blades moving again that i finally got a new blender. I was about to get another 35 dollar one but decided that its worth getting something more expensive that actually works. i just made a smoothie and it took THREE SECONDS. THREE. what a game changer, i am so excited (ugh what adults are excited about these days! haha) I just hope that this product lasts!! it certainly feels like its got a great motor!
customer_reviews.author: becka

customer_reviews.title: Cracked and Unusable After 5 Months
customer_reviews.text: We got this blender in May 2018 and it worked wonderfully until it cracked all over the blender after never being dropped. I’ve seen other reviews about the blender ending up with 4 cracks coming from the bottom when blending ice - we didn’t even do that! Mine has cracks all along the bottom and all the way up the sides causing it to leak profusely despite trying to duct tape it. We called Ninja for a replacement and were told it would come in 4-6 weeks. It’s been 4 weeks with no notice of it being shipped. Overall extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Best blender we had so far
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it makes a whole lot of sense to review after only using it for a week but here we are. Compared to the blenders I had before, this seems well thought through. I am impressed with its power. We make shakes pretty often combining frozen fruit such as bananas and milk. It blends even a solid frozen banana without a problem. It’s easy to use and easy to clean. I researched a long time before deciding to get this blender and I wished I ordered it sooner. So far I am absolutely thrilled with this powerful machine. I will update my review in a few month to review its durability.
customer_reviews.author: God Is Everywhere

customer_reviews.title: Superb!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best investment in my health I have made in a long time!This thing is wonderful for green smoothies,fruit infused smoothies and salsas and so much more.The ice crushing ability is unsurpassed by any blender I have used. It's easy to clean and use ,no fuss,I will get plenty of use from this,thank you Amazon again for great products, prices and speedy delivery. I'm never dissatisfied by any experience with you all and proud to be an Amazon Prime member.
customer_reviews.author: Starchaser

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully. Read warning.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Will come if I have any complications. *knock on wood* it runs beautifully and smoothly. It purees ice and frozen fruit in a matter of seconds. Easy to clean and the lock in handle is convenient. The only warning is to be careful when cleaning, the blades are very sharp. I have professional knives and they are about as sharp. It is a tad bit larger than your average blender. Also the container is plastic. I was under the assumption it was glass but I'm happy with it either way.
customer_reviews.author: Hayhay

customer_reviews.title: Terrible blender
customer_reviews.text: Worst blender. This blender worked for about 4 weeks and then it cracked on the side and was leaking everywhere. We did nothing cause it to crack. My cheap blender lasted years yet this one only lasted a month and broke.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Schreiner

customer_reviews.title: great for smoothies!
customer_reviews.text: After my old blender gave up the ghost, I got this. I was a little skeptical because of the plastic canister... but man is this thing awesome! I love the power and the design is perfect - the tall blade unit is easy to take out and clean, frozen smoothie stuff never gets stuck or needs stirring like my old blender. I didn't use my old blender as much as I would have liked, because it was such a hassle to get smoothies pureed to the right consistency, but my kids and I have been using this ninja every morning now for a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: BrazilNut

customer_reviews.title: Power to Spare
customer_reviews.text: This blender has enough weight to feel sturdy and not move around at all while blending even the thickest shakes. The 1000-Watt motor has the power to handle whatever we've thrown at it. Prior to buying it, I read some reviews that mentioned the pour-spout lid sometimes broke. If you pay attention while using and cleaning, I don't see this as a product defect but more as a misuse issue (like accidentally hitting the open lid against the side of the sink). Bottom line: Works great. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Craig W

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Warning to others. These blades are very sharp! On my first use with this blender I took off the lid and poured out my smoothie. To my surprise, the blades are not connected inside, they fell out, fell to the floor and sliced my shoe, sock and my big toe. Thank god I was wearing shoes! This may not necessarily happen to you but if I can save one person with this review, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Graupera

customer_reviews.title: Easy! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to blend protein shakes. The center column with its spire of multiple blades, gets the job done fast and efficiently. Very easy to clean up. This is important in that I use this quite often and don't care to chance putting any of the components into the dishwasher. So the fact that a quick rinse with hot water easily gets all remaining food off the parts is a big plus!
customer_reviews.author: ThinkmanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you like your smoothies smooth
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this thing; I made the mistake, like an idiot, because I read other reviews saying "it started out great, but after 40 blends or so it no longer makes smoothies smooth". I read this, like I read reviews before purchasing most everything I plan on keeping for a while, and most everyone said " buy the vitamix ". I had a hard time spending $400 on the Vitamix and bought this POS. I wasted $90 on the ninja, though I brought it to my beach house for renters to use when I'm not there...The Vitamix comes with me! If you drink smoothies every day like I do, buy the Vitamix.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick schrepping

customer_reviews.title: This is THE BEST blender I have had
customer_reviews.text: I have used this now for a few months before writing a review. This is THE BEST blender I have had. I can't afford the vitamix, so I bought this. I juice protein powder with frozen fruit almost everyday now, and only because this makes it so easy. Blends ice/water/frozen fruit/and powder so well. My husband loves me having it because we both benefits with the protein drinks. This is and affordable amazing blender.
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: The pitcher design is flawed for so many reasons
customer_reviews.text: I agree 100% with another one star review . I loved it for a few months except for the fact that foods would stay up in the corner of the pitcher and never blend smaller than graffiti, especially spinach Why the square shape?!. After two months the engagement pin in the handle would not engage and allow the motor to run! I had to push it down with a tooth pick through the handle that was beginning to peel away. I used this every day to make my protein shakes for breakfast and lunch. The unit now sits in the garage waiting to go out with next weeks garbage. Don't do it I tell you!
customer_reviews.author: philip scandariato

customer_reviews.title: Chunky Smoothies
customer_reviews.text: We have the little personal Ninja blender and we love it. It blends things well and we get smooth consistency in our smoothies. I purchased this blender for big smoothie batches and for things like soup and making almond milk. This is great for things that can be a little chunky... IE soup and blending almonds for almond milk. BUT it does not blend smooth enough for smoothies. There are always small chunks of stuff that don't get blended. I've had better $20 blenders from big box stores. I wouldn't purchase this again. It's great for some things, not for anything you want a smooth, chunk free blend on.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect working order everything well packaged
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect working order everything well packaged. I'm 30 so I've seen a lot of blenders over the years, this blender is one of the best I've used and I've only had it in my home for a few hours. First and fore most the lid locks down and may be trusted not to pop off. Second: the blades are not locked in place making removal easy. Third: and sadly the only flaw I don't recommend this blender for ice.
customer_reviews.author: coderider

customer_reviews.title: Great smoothie maker
customer_reviews.text: This blender works great for smoothies from frozen fruit and also homemade sherbet using frozen fruit. The only gripe I have about it is that it is a bit challenging to clean the blades and lid. First the blades are very sharp so you have to be very careful to not cut yourself and the lid has a lot of nooks and crannies, granted if you have a dishwasher this wouldn't be as much of an issue. Overall the blender fits my needs very well and I did purchase the additional warranty from SquareTrade so I am covered if anything happens in the next couple of years, which with daily use could easily happen.
customer_reviews.author: chiseptum

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new, got the old and used
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and paid for a NEW Ninja blender. Instead I received a used one with gunk, scrapes, and rust all over this thing. Immediately placed it back in its package to process a full refund. Even after reading all the reviews, I was trying to give this a shot but if things are already bad immediately after unboxing, probably going to go downhill and experience what other bad reviews are saying with durability, warranty issues, safety hazards, etc. To have a stock of returned used items and mailing them out as NEW orders isn't a good sign at all. Not a recommended product. Better yet, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aku

customer_reviews.title: Worst blender
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst blender I have ever purchased. I used it all of three times and the light wouldn't stop flashing even though I had it aligned properly. I called customer service and they were absolutely useless. Turns out that even though the blender says dish washer safe you can only put it on the top shelf which doesn't make sense because it's too big to fit on any standard dishwashers top shelf. Apparently a piece on the jug melted off in the dishwasher. Needless to say I am never buying one of their products again.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Great high powered blender
customer_reviews.text: Love this blender. We had been looking for a high power blender for awhile and I couldn't settle on one because i didn't want to spend so much and end up with something that let me down, but finally took the jump and got this one and I'm so glad i did! We've made plenty of smoothies and it handles the ice without a problem. I've also used it to make Graham cracker crusts for cheesecakes and it does a great job at making everything a consistent size and texture. It's still loud, but it's no louder than most blenders.
customer_reviews.author: J. Berks

customer_reviews.title: Good blender - great for smoothies
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Great for smoothies. Having the blades along a shaft from bottom to top of pitcher seems to result in faster more efficient action when compared to models with blades only at the bottom. The pitcher is fairly large so if you only want to do one serving at a time you might consider similar models that include the option of individual serving containers. I prefer this size to make a full batch and keep second or third servings for another day or two without any apparent loss of freshness. You do need to be careful in handling the blade shaft especially when washing by hand or reassembling - the blades are very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Rick E.

customer_reviews.title: What a joy!
customer_reviews.text: My mother who lives with us needs to have her food pureed now. The blender we had could not handle pureeing many of our usual food items. After some research I decided to try the Ninja Professional Blender (BL610). Now most evenings when Mom smells dinner cooking she can look forward to enjoying the same freshly prepared meal we are having. What a joy!
customer_reviews.author: J in PA

customer_reviews.title: Canister cracked after two uses
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews even when I'm unhappy with a product. This product was so poorly manufactured that I felt I had to write a review. I have used this only twice to make smoothies and the plastic canister has already cracked making it completely unusable. For $80 I would definitely choose something different. Wish I had listened to previous reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal resident

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for the first few months, but then the blades became very dull. We have a green smoothie every morning with LOTS of vegetables. The smoothies were becoming more and more 'chunky' and hard to get through even a huge smoothie straw. I tried to get a replacement part but there are NONE for this model. Since we realized that we are very committed to daily green smoothies, we ended up buying a Vitamix and WOW!! what a huge difference! I never knew that you didn't have to 'chew' a green smoothie!! The Ninja never blended our smoothies to a puree consistency. The Ninja is fine for some things, but it doesn't compare to a Vitamix!
customer_reviews.author: L. M.

customer_reviews.title: GRRRRREATT
customer_reviews.text: I'm 73 and have owned a lot of blenders in my life. From $30 to $300. and this is without a doubt the Best I've ever owned. Locks in place and lid locks in place. I do smoothies and frozen rum and tequlia drinks. Definately reccommend. 1 week later, the blender has taken a dump. Returning it and will get another one. 8/11/20 OK. Amazon delivered new blender yesterday. It works as it should. Thanks, Amazon. 8/16 Very Pleased with this blender
customer_reviews.author: jeff novak

customer_reviews.title: I regret very few things.  This is one of them.
customer_reviews.text: I've never hated a blender before this one, and I've bought blenders for $12 before. As other reviewers have mentioned, this does not do a good job of chopping up ingredients AT ALL. I make muffins and smoothies and regularly end up digging whole spinach leaves out of the carafe after several minutes of just letting the thing run. YES, it does great with ice. That's it. Additionally, the design of the carafe and lid (square) means that water splashes off at all angles when you're trying to rinse / wash the thing. I dread any time this stupid thing needs to be brought out of the cabinet and cannot wait to buy something else. I miss my old KitchenAid.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great, but just one wish
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have loved everything about this blender. Yes it is noisy but it is a machine chopping up your food at high RPM. My only wish for this blender is that the pitcher was made out of Pyrex glass, not plastic. While it remains to be seen, I fear that repeated trips through the dishwasher will eventually weaken and crack the plastic, hopefully not during blending operations.
customer_reviews.author: David Philip Feyen

customer_reviews.title: I hate this blender!
customer_reviews.text: I like a thick smoothie which my $30 old blender made just fine until I broke it (5 years later). I decided to splurge and buy this blender, HUGE MISTAKE. The first day of use I had to scrape the sides of the blender to get all the fruit mixed in then when I drank it there were still huge clumps of fruit in it. So the next day I tried to scrape the sides, mix with a spoon and blend for a longer period and I still had clumps in my smoothie or should I say clumpy. Save your money and buy a much less expensive blender that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Ninja Ultima Blender where the pin broke on the lid. I searched in vain for a replacement lid but couldnt find one. We make alot of smoothies and it was powerful enough to grind the frozen fruit easily without any intervention from me. So when I got this one I noticed how plasticy and lightweight all the components were; when I made smoothies I had to constantly stop and push the fruit down into the liquid to get it to blend properly. I am so tired of China trying to rip us off with products that get less well made with each iteration. Returning and will never buy another Ninja again.
customer_reviews.author: BigDaddy

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Blenders to have
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this blender! I use to have one of the original Ninja Bullet blender and it suck! Ninja blenders weren't cheap thats for sure but finding this one at a great price is what i needed. Ive been using it for a couple of days and love it!. Ive made Pina Colodas and Frozen Smoothies. When its on its on, blending it at its finest. When it blends ice it looks like snow. When it blends frozen fruits you dont get any chunks left behind. Its raw power when it comes to this blender. The container is made out of plastic Power station BIG but packs power! The blades are sharp and its one piece
customer_reviews.author: Qi W.

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase Amazon Asurion insurance
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the blender almost daily for 11 months. The blades got dull so I contacted Asurion for replacement, since we purchased 3-year warranty plan. They wanted me to call manufacturer because of their 1 year warranty; that's after 20 minutes phone conversation. I asked whether asurion would extend the insurance by one year if we contacted manufacturer, but they said no. Since I refused to make that phone call and insisted on blades replacement the rep said that the manager would call me by Monday or Tuesday. We were hoping to get the new blades by then ... Let's see what the manager is going to say next week.
customer_reviews.author: Nave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Easy to clean, Doesn’t need stir stick!
customer_reviews.text: I burnt up 2 blenders within the past few weeks making smoothies with frozen fruit, before I spent the extra money on this one. I was worried because it doesn’t have the stir stick but let me tell you, you don’t need it! This thing is awesome for smoothies! It breaks up the seeds of strawberries and other fruits into tiny pieces that you can’t even tell are there. I love that the whole blender contained can go into the dishwasher without being broken apart, didn’t realize how much I would like that! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I like the blender. It does the job but, I wish it blended things like spinach a little bit more finely. The blades don't quite get far enough to the edge and little bits seem to escape the blades. This is a very minor complaint. I also find it annoying that the lid needs to latch on while the blending is in progress. Sometimes I like to add ingredients after the blending has commenced. My old blender had a removable center on the lid to do just this and I definitely miss that feature. On the positive, its so easy to clean! The fact that the blade comes out makes all the difference in the world.
customer_reviews.author: otiliorules

customer_reviews.title: Crapshoot whether you'll get one that works for a while
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 8 months ago and used it maybe once a week up until recently. Now I use it about 2-3 times a week, and suddenly the bearings are squeaking when I turn it off. For $85, this should've lasted a lot longer. I contacted the seller about a replacement (even just the bearings), and they never contacted me back. I won't buy a Ninja again, and I won't buy one from "100% Authentic SaleOff" again. Just buy it from Ninja so that you can at least have a warranty for the inevitable failure.
customer_reviews.author: CSFC

customer_reviews.title: Two pitchers cracked at the base in six months.
customer_reviews.text: I love that the blender really does make snow. My daily treat is my own homemade sugar-free slushie. Unfortunately, the plastic pitcher is not up to the power of the motor in combination with daily ice crushing. The original pitcher cracked in five months starting at the hole/base adjacent to blade mechanism, and my replacement pitcher cracked the same way with just two months of use. Replacements cost $60, which is crazy for such cheap manufacturing. They really should upgrade to a glass jar that can withstand daily crushing it was advertised to withstand.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Macgregor

customer_reviews.title: Buy the protection plan!
customer_reviews.text: I've have this unit just under 3 years, and it works pretty well. But recently the lid got stuck. There are videos on YouTube that may work (the butter knife technique worked for me at first) but if you need to replace the lid, you will pay $36+ here on Amazon or $64.95 for the pitcher and lid on the product site. When I called SharkNinja, the best they could do was to offer me a brand new unit that would have cost the same as buying it here on Amazon when calculating for shipping. Seeing that others are having this problem, I am going to find another brand and also purchase a protection plan.
customer_reviews.author: City Gal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the Quality Conpared to the Price
customer_reviews.text: There was a crack in the plastic when this blender arrived, but it didn’t seem to compromise the ability of the blender. Six months later, however, the blender leaks all over the base every time it is used. We are very disappointed in the quality of this blender in comparison to the price.
customer_reviews.author: G.Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in late November. Used 3-5 times and it stopped working mid March. This is the second Ninja Blender that has been poor quality for me. I never even added anything except berries, ice cream and liquids (no ice). Now, it won't turn on anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia R.

customer_reviews.title: The pitcher started to leak through the axle after two months.
customer_reviews.text: After two months of use the pitcher started to leak. It created a mess every time I used it. I checked the pitcher and there is no damages. It is a problem of axel. I called for support and guess what! the pitcher is not cover by the warranty. Ninja offered a replacement for $64 plus taxes. The entire unit cost $99. Total waste of money and this type of product and support is really poor. It supposed to be a good and durable product. I do not recommend to buy. Try other brands.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jimenez Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great product, incredibly sharp blade
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this after having an older ninja model for a couple years. Very glad that they made a change to allow the blender to remain on without you keeping a hand on it. I tried to dry the blade with a dish towel and the blade cut through the dish towel and through my thumb. Be extremely careful when handling and/or cleaning the blade. It's razor sharp. Otherwise, big big fan of this product.
customer_reviews.author: PatrickTM

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further
customer_reviews.text: Look no Further, if you want an excellent blender with professional features. 1. Ultra Sharp Blades. 2. Giant upgrade from Magic Bullet. 3/ 3 sets of blades to prevent "Slush Lock". 4. It's a professional blender, 5. Many professional features. Such as the sound of the motor. 6. Fantastic Lid Lock. A Must. 7. Pulse and Pulse Override of the other speeds. Pulse is always High Speed. Pressing Pulse while operating at any of the other 3 speeds, overrides it to Pulse. Again the blades are Ultra Sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: cracked after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 months the blender pitcher cracked and leaks. I only hand wash even tough it says it's dishwasher safe. I have never used the amount of ice it shows in the photos or describes on the info and only use it couple of times a week so why did it crack? It is now basically useless because whatever liquid I put in it runs out and down to the base now and I imagine it will only get worse! A waste of $$ for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Auclailr

customer_reviews.title: I love this blender
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender. It's easy to use and easy to clean. This is my first blender and I didn't even have to read the instructions to figure out how to use it. Sometimes when it begins to blend, pieces of fruit/vegetables stick to the glass (such as a spinach leaf) and you have to turn it off and push the piece of fruit/vegetable back down to blend, but that's my only "issue" so far. It creates smooth smoothies. I've been using it twice a day for two weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd get excited over a blender. How did I live so long without this thing? It is well designed, easy to clean. I like the way the blades are held in place by the lid which makes them easy to remove. It is powerful, and with three blades, blends in a snap. Wish I had purchased this years ago...
customer_reviews.author: Gary Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: Best blender I've had, and I'm no spring chicken
customer_reviews.text: I've had Hamilton Beach, Oster, and many other blenders over the years, and this one is a luxury. It works incredibly well, is probably less noisy than most, very solid on the counter (doesn't walk by itself), and the top clamps on so you don't have to hold onto it. Really a great blender. FINALLY.
customer_reviews.author: nalissa

customer_reviews.title: It blends
customer_reviews.text: First thing I want viewers to see is that the actual plastic container is extremely thin and feels cheap. I used it however daily and it never broke, however I made simple drinks with only water and powder. I can't review how well it may work with other ingredients however for my use it's lasted over a year with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lid is the weak link
customer_reviews.text: Blender is wonderful at turning fruit into smoothies. It is not quite as efficient as our kitchen aid diamond at mixing. However, we are just starting our 4th month with it and the lid release mechanism is jammed. I disassembled the unit and it appears that when you push the release button the locking tabs slide back to release the lid and that opposite these tabs (internally) are pistons that slide through a guide hole. One of the pistons is catching on the post with the guide hole. If the pistons were slightly longer, there would not be an issue. A quick search shows that a replacement lid is about 1/2 the cost of a new blender.
customer_reviews.author: TheFixer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic pitcher not durable.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Ninja to break. This one only lasted two days past the Amazon return limit date. This one had a plastic pitcher that cracked and leaked out of the side and bottom. I cut my finger on the blade the first time I attempted to clean it. Wish they had a glass picture and it was more durable. It’s a hassle to get replacements even though it is still in warranty and one has to pay $20 to repair plus shipping which is almost half the cost of s new one.
customer_reviews.author: J D Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Snow cones, smoothies to Bahama Mamas
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blender, ice crusher. I saw a review in Consumer Reports and decided to try this model. We live in a hot climate and used crushed ice in many drinks, cones, alcohol and other. There is no better ice crusher. Noisy, yes....but snow cones to Bahama Mamas.....this blender is terrific. It’s easy to clean, but must be careful of full length cutting rod as it is wicked sharp. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great power, easy to use, awesome for smoothies!
customer_reviews.text: I make smoothies every day and my little Oster blender just wasn’t able to handle the abuse. This blender has the power to crush pretty much anything! I love that the blades extend up to the top of the blender instead of just the bottom, so everything you put in there gets munched up at the same time. You don’t end up with a nicely blended smoothie on the bottom and big chunks at the top. It’s easy to take apart and clean (which I do every day) and it’s relatively quiet. This blender made my life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Calvert

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE this Blender!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Ninja because our old blender only had the standard blade in the bottom. It simply could not mix things or chop things well because of the small blade. The Ninja however, is a beast! This blender chips ice is a second flat! It handles nuts and all vegetables with ease. The triple blade is perfect, it creates a vortex in the blender that mixes and chops items evenly and completely. We make pesto frequently with nuts , olive oil and basil and such and it comes out creamy and perfect every time. Big thumbs up for the Ninja!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Dupoise

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best smoothies!
customer_reviews.text: This little beauty is by far the best blender we’ve ever owned. We love smoothies around here and this blender handles frozen fruit with ease! The blades are placed from top to bottom on an easy to remove and clean column. The pitcher has a flip up pour spout so it doesn’t splatter. My 11 year has become the smoothie queen around here and she absolutely LOVES this blender. It’s easy to use, easy to clean and has some serious blending power! Absolutely would buy again. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MK Wood

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last the test of time
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this blender for almost a year, making smoothies pretty consistently and now it has started leaking out the bottom. At first it was just a bit but now when I am making a smoothie it is just pouring out. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Cracked After Only A Few Uses
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this blender given the 4.5 star average review, but I'm very confused as to how this blender has maintained that rating. 1) After only a few uses (less than 10), the bottom of the pitcher cracked resulting in liquid leaking through the bottom and all over the base of the blender and my countertop. 2) It does not blend smoothies well. Add any kind of greens and it comes out grainy with tiny bits of spinach/kale/etc. 3) It is VERY loud compared to other blenders I've used (nutribullet & vitamix specifically). Would not recommend this blender. Vitamix is well worth the investment for a high-quality powerful blender.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast.... Amazing blender
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. It just a monster. Makes perfect smoothies and mixed drinks. The multi spiral blade makes it so nice large ice chunks are not left in your drink. Its very heavy duty mixing dispenser as well. The positive locking lid makes it so you dont make a mess while blending. It also has an easy pour spout. Cleaning up is a breeze as the blade easily slips out to clean. it has a nice compact size but it is quite tall.
customer_reviews.author: Thor

customer_reviews.title: In Love
customer_reviews.text: This product is a dream come true. My first Ninja product and I will never go with any other brand. In my other machine I had for years, I had to hold the lid down and the whole unit as it worked (or tried to) because it would dance all over the counter and the lid would come off. I love how I can turn this unit on, press a speed and watch it work. I want to get one for my mother and my kids. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Zahavah F.

customer_reviews.title: Best Blender I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: First I should say that there are probably better blenders out there but they are way overpriced. This blender comes in at about $80 and honestly that is a steal. I have always used Kitchen Aid's and never been satisfied. This blender is amazingly sharp, has 3 sets of blades that chops, dices, and obliterates ice like its no ones business. I am very pleased and would highly recommend this blender to anyone concerned with blades being dull. I cut myself on accident cleaning it. THEY ARE SHARP AF!!! Buy this blender, don't think twice. Thank me later ;)
customer_reviews.author: Cindy burton

customer_reviews.title: Vendor, great. Quality of Ninja, meh
customer_reviews.text: It blends my smoothies and salsas as well as the Hamilton Beach blender which costs a third of the price. Overrated. Bulky. Perfect for margaritas, pina coladas or anything with lots of ice. Doesn't really grind, my raw oatmeal for instance, in the smoothies
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not to die on me, after one year of use!
customer_reviews.text: Your money's worth for your investment! Great product! Cannot go wrong with "NINJA" products. I highly recommend this blender, because it accomplished what I'd wanted: My "Sofrito" of mixed vegetables: Garlic Cloves, Green/Red/Yellow Peppers, Sweet peppers, Coriander/Cilantro, Yellow Onions, Red Onions, cherry tomatoes; and "Bam, Bam!" All 42 oz. of my "Sofrito" was done in less than a minute! My wife needed it, to blend her eggs for our traditional Vanilla Flan (Vanilla Custard). Scale 1 thru 10? Is a 10 definitively, and my 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!
customer_reviews.author: Gunny

customer_reviews.title: Great blender for smoothies.
customer_reviews.text: We had a 10 year old Ninga that finally bit the dust. After looking at products and examining reviews and price, I bought this one as our replacement. We make a lot of smoothies, and I also occasionally use for blending soup. So far, this blender is fantastic. It blends well. Easy to clean in the dishwasher, although I dislike that the blade doesn't disassemble into smaller parts. It has to lay sideways in the top rack using up space and having dangerous blades sticking up. Not a deal breaker for me, but a minor annoyance. I'd recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best blender for the money! Solid review from CR!
customer_reviews.text: This blender is amazing. It blows the doors off my Oster blender that is losing steam from old age[17yrs]. It is louder but it blends in 1/4 of the time that the Oster required. I also have a hand blender from Bruan that this Ninja outperforms. The speed and the six blades make all the difference. Additionally, it received solid reviews from CR. My brother stands by his 500$ Vitamix. I will take the Ninja for 100$ everyday.
customer_reviews.author: PinkTwig

customer_reviews.title: Just Adequate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this while my VitaMix was sent back for repairs after 7 years of heavy use. This has barely enough power to make a decent smoothie.......and doesn't get it smooth enough for me. Cleaning is a hassle with the scary blades to remove. Now the Vita-Mix has tons of power for anything you throw in, liquefies totally and clean-up is so simple. So this Ninja will get you by, but it sure doesn't seem like it will last. At 4 times the price, the VitaMix is still 5 stars and worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W

customer_reviews.title: Powerful & Secure
customer_reviews.text: Had ours for 4 weeks. I love the power of this blender! It’s replacing an old one (different brand) & it works so much better. We make smoothies 7-12 times a week with juice, yogurt, frozen fruit & ice. You just put the ingredients into it, lock the lid & blend! No stopping or having to mix with a spoon half-way. You could even step away from it while it’s blending b/c the lid locks on. The blades go all the way up the center instead of just being on the bottom. The carafe is huge - we usually make 3 servings at once & there’s still plenty of space for even more.
customer_reviews.author: Spatty

customer_reviews.title: Not good for making frozen drinks
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reasons I bought this is to make frozen drinks and I am very disappointed. I like my smooth frozen drinks to be smooth. This blender does not make frozen drinks that are smooth. You will be left with a huge amount of smallish chunks of ice. I thought this blender would be good for this job but it is not. I did, however, try running it on the highest speed for roughly 2.5 minutes and it made a reasonably smooth drink. I deemed this length of time on high to be unacceptable. Cleanup is not bad. Noise is considerable.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Cracked pitcher— total rip-off!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Add me to the broken pitcher club. Bought this not even six weeks ago to make smoothies for surgery recovery. Being out of work for two months this was a sizable expense for me and it’s already broken; before I’ve even returned to work. The replacement pitcher is a laughable $65 on the manufacturer website. Please listen to the other reviews—I did not and now have a useless blender and no way to make smoothies I need for my inability to chew. As far as blending power in par with the one serving types I’ve used over the years for $15.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: High quality smoothie maker, worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I find myself making smoothies often with ice. My old smoothie broke when I tried blending ice within it. However, the Ninja Professional Blender gets the job done with ease. The blender can chop through ice, frozen fruits, and many other tough ingredients. It is very sturdy, and has three power options. In my opinion, this is an essential household product if you are need of a blender.
customer_reviews.author: Bibi

customer_reviews.title: Best Blender I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Have been making numerous concoctions involving ice and my old blender just wasn't doing that great. It would take me 15 minutes of blending sometimes and lots of scraping, etc. Saw the Ninja touted by some YouTubers so gave it a shot. This thing is amazing. It does in seconds what I couldn't accomplish with a standard blender in those 15 minutes. And its EASY to clean and disassemble, dishwasher safe, etc. Best purchase in a while :)
customer_reviews.author: MazNJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this blender
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for smoothies and it works so well. I've used it for over two weeks and so far so good. No issues. I pile my veggies/fruits into my blender and whip up a smoothie for the family. I love my smoothies with almonds and it tackles them and frozen fruit really well. Just let the blender run a little bit longer to blend everything to perfection if you have nuts in there. I love the way the power button blinks to indicate the blender is not properly covered and so it would not start till it's properly covered.
customer_reviews.author: Ijourney

customer_reviews.title: Blend it, baby!
customer_reviews.text: Yaaaasss! I got frustrated with my little cheap "handheld" blender that always missed what seemed like the biggest piece of fruit. Like, how?!?!? So I finally just went for a solid, quality blender. My parents have an older version of this and I love using it when I visit, figured it was time to get my own. So here I am, a couple months in to my new relationship and lemme tell ya, she BLEND! Super easy to clean - be careful around the blades, they can slice you like buttah - and easy to use. I have a small kitchen so I was hesitant to get something so big, but she is WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Jean

customer_reviews.title: Great blender, pay someone to clean it
customer_reviews.text: This is the same basic cleanup problem as the Cuisinart food processor: way too many places for food and water to get trapped forever. It will never be as clean as when it came out of the box. The lid fills with water and you cant get it out. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: L. D. Smith IITop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted this brand of blender and purchased it on amazon prime day for a great deal ($55). I'm so glad I didn't pay full price. It claims "ice crushing technology" but when I make my smoothies, I am still crunching on chunks of ice. My old blender works better than this! I also don't like cleaning it. My first time washing I cut my finger open on the blade. It is very sharp (so I wonder why it doesn't blend all ice!) and when you handle it, there is no protection. If I knew what I know now, I wouldn't have purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Wish the container didn't crack
customer_reviews.text: This could be the world's best blender if the container didn't get cracks - everyone I ask says the same thing. If you put hot liquid in it you may have it for 6 months if you are lucky. Then you have an excellent blender without a plastic container. And don't try to buy a replacement part because you can buy a new entire blender on sale for less than a replacement container. The manufacturer says it can take hot liquids. I am very careful with my appliances so it was not abused.
customer_reviews.author: Mardi

customer_reviews.title: Frappe anyone??
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are clear. Turns ice into anything frosty that you can think of. Do you have any idea how much Starbucks charges for a coffee slush? It's paid for itself twice over already. I'm in love!!
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this blender - company does not honor warrenty
customer_reviews.text: Broken twice in 6 months and customer service wanted to charge me for replacement parts! I never write reviews but I want to warn all future consumers of the extremely poor quality/durability of this pitcher. Picture cracks after a couple months of use. Customer service is also not helpful and you will spend an hour on the phone if you attempt to contact them. I was told by the Ninja rep (John ID#20080) the warranty does not cover the pitcher. In other words, the main part of a blender where the blending actually happens is not covered by their warranty. Clearly an outstourced staff that does not care about the company brand. Lost a customer for life :(
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: Purchase the Ninja blender in October middle December it just stopped done all the troubleshooting looked at 3 videos on YouTube evidently this product has a problem was just stopping and not operating, does a great job when it works the troubles keeping it working I'll go back to the more high-end this is just television quick sell junk,
customer_reviews.author: Rickard

customer_reviews.title: Plastic mixing container very weak.
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after purchasing in October 2018, chips in the plastic began forming. This has been used for smoothies only, frozen fruit, yogurt, and milk. No ice. Tonight a one in hole blew out the side sending smoothie all over the kitchen. I never even found the broken plastic piece.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up for daily use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this July 2019. Within 2 months the plastic canister was cracking (no, we don’t do very hot or frozen food blending, no ice cube crushing). Ninja sent a replacement canister, stressing that it was a one-time-only replacement. This morning the canister locking lid release button stopped working. Something jammed/cracked inside the mechanism. I called service number and waited on silent hold for 15 minutes but service agent never picked up. This thing is going in the trash. We’ll unearth the old blender with glass jar and flex rubber top. It wasn’t blending as quickly as it once did, but it was still working...
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best, the very best blender I’ve ever had and I’m still impressed with the price. The power, the multiple blades and the performance of this machine leave nothing unblended. Nothing negative yet and don’t expect anything. One nice fillip is the Impression the Ninja makes on guests, “Wow! “You need a pilot’s license to fly this?” and several asked if they could make their own smoothies. Based on my experience you will not be disappointed with this Ninja And I have to admit I like that it impresses my guests. And it is real easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: BobinPV

customer_reviews.title: Best I ever had
customer_reviews.text: Ive broken too many blenders in my lifetime. I'm not easy on my blenders since I need to make high-density shakes and such, but this guy is a BEAST. I put ice in it for the first time and it ate it right up. I use milk, Huel, and protein powder with ice cream and ice normally. It takes it all, and it cleans super nicely too since the blades come out AND my wife showed me that you can just put water and soap in and it does the work for you. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: earshine

customer_reviews.title: NEW GENERATION DESIGN SHOWS HOW FAR WE'VE COME WITH A BLENDER
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well-designed blender that an grind anything without breaking a sweat. Easier than anything I have seen prior to clean as you easily remove the blades and clean the inside very quickly, blades just wash off and that's good because they're sharp beyond description, and the design of the lid is genius. Really like the way it locks into place on the base so you don't get partial engagement of the driving gear. Nice design. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I’m Just Disgusted
customer_reviews.text: This thing blends like a dream. Unfortunately, the second time I used it, the little plastic pin that pushes in the button allowing it to run broke off the canister. So now we have a $100 paperweight that worked once. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: AngelaS

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Put the "Smooth" in "Smoothie"
customer_reviews.text: If you're interested in making green smoothies like I am, you might want to look elsewhere. Even on the highest setting, my smoothie (kale, banana, apple, and 2% milk) is chunky and chewy (see picture). Seeing a video review comparing this blender to the KitchenAid 5-speed Diamond Blender has convinced me that if I want to put the "smooth" in "smoothie", I need to get the latter, which is ostensibly quieter and blends veggies very well. Will be returning this one tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, clean and does a great job
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost every day to make smoothies. I have also used it to blend vegetables in soups. It works amazingly well. It is super easy to clean and put together. I have put it in the dishwasher many times also. I could not recommend it highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: A

product_meta.title: Ninja Professional 72 Oz Countertop Blender with 1000-Watt Base and Total Crushing Technology for Smoothies, Ice and Frozen Fruit (BL610), Black
product_meta.description:
The Ninja professional blender 1000 features a sleek design and outstanding performance with 1000 watts of professional power. Ninja total crushing blades gives you perfect ice crushing, blending, pureeing, and controlled processing. The XL 72 oz. Professional blender jar is great for making drinks and smoothies for the whole family.

BRAND STORY
By Ninja
feature_bullets: The Ninja professional blender 1000 features a sleek design and outstanding performance with 1000 watts of professional power 64 ounce maximum liquid capacity
Ninja total crushing blades gives you perfect ice crushing, blending, pureeing, and controlled processing crush ice and frozen fruit in seconds

The 72 ounce professional blender jar is perfect for making large batches of creamy, frozen drinks and smoothies for the entire family also perfect for large batches of delicious margaritas and daiquiris
Blast ice into snow in seconds and blend your favorite ingredients into delicious sauces, dips and smoothies
6 blade assembly allows you to crush ice faster and blend ingredients smoother than other blenders. To clean the motor base, use a damp cloth to wipe clean

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars11,741 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
